At that time, the World-Honored One expounded the subtle Dharma of his own realization, which is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its meaning profound and its phrasing excellent, pure and immaculate, the adornment of the pure life.

Then King BimbisÄra said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
How is it that sentient beings' previously created karma, long since destroyed, all manifest at the time of death?
Moreover, all dharmas are entirely empty and nonexistent, yet the retribution for created karma is not lost?
I only pray that the World-Honored One, out of compassion, will explain this for me.
At that time, the World-Honored One told King BimbisÄra:
Great King, you should know, it is like a man who, in a dream, sees himself having intimate relations with a beautiful woman.
After waking up, he remembers the beautiful woman he saw in the dream. Great King, what do you think?
Is the beautiful woman in the dream real or not?
The king said:
It is not real!
The World-Honored One said:
Great King, what do you think?
Can this man, who remembers the beautiful woman he saw in the dream and longs for her without letting go, be called a very knowledgeable and wise person?
The king said:
No, that is not so!
This is a foolish person, not a wise one.
Why is it so?
Because the beautiful human woman in his dream is ultimately empty and cannot be obtained.
How could he be able to have intimate relations with her, causing this man to feel affection and give rise to thoughts of her?
The Buddha said:
Great King!
It is like this.
Foolish, ignorant ordinary people, when the eye sees forms, the mind gives rise to joy and delight, and then gives rise to attachment;
having given rise to attachment, they then give rise to longing; having given rise to longing, they harbor defiled love;
because of giving rise to defiled love, they follow greed, anger, and delusion, and create various karmic actions with body, speech, and mind.

However, these karmic actions, once created, are destroyed. When they are destroyed, they do not abide in the east, nor do they abide in the south, west, north, the four intermediate directions, or above and below. At the time of death, when the mental consciousness is about to cease, all the karmic actions one has done will appear.
It is like a man who, after waking from sleep, remembers the images of beautiful women he saw in his dream.
Great King!
When the previous consciousness ceases and the subsequent consciousness arises, one may be reborn among humans, in the heavens, or fall into the realms of animals, hungry ghosts, or hell beings.
Great King!
When the subsequent consciousness arises, it immediately gives rise to a mind of the same kind, and the continuity flows on, clearly experiencing the ripening of what was done.
Great King!
There has never been a dharma that can pass from this world to the next world, yet the results of karmic actions in birth and death can be obtained.
Great King, you should know that when the previous consciousness ceases, it is called death, and when the subsequent consciousness arises, it is called birth.
Great King!
When the previous consciousness ceases, there is no place to go, and when the subsequent consciousness arises, there is nowhere it comes from.
Why is this?
Because the intrinsic nature is empty.
Great King!

The previous consciousness is empty of the intrinsic nature of the previous consciousness, death is empty of the intrinsic nature of death, karma is empty of the intrinsic nature of karma, the subsequent consciousness is empty of the intrinsic nature of the subsequent consciousness, birth is empty of the intrinsic nature of birth, yet the fruits of karma are never lost.
Great King!
Thus you should know that all sentient beings, due to delusion and confusion, do not understand what is not real and mistakenly give rise to attachment, revolving in the cycle of birth and death.
At that time, the World-Honored One, wishing to restate this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
All dharmas are only provisional names, established merely based on names.
Apart from the expressive words, the expressed cannot be obtained.
All are expressed by separate names, expressing those various dharmas.
In the Dharma of names, there is no existence, this is the intrinsic nature of all dharmas.
Because names are empty of the nature of names, names do not exist in names,
The names of all dharmas are originally non-existent, falsely using names to explain names,
All dharmas are false, only arising from discrimination,
This discrimination is also empty, falsely discriminating within emptiness.
I say that in the world, the eye sees forms,
All due to false conceptual thoughts, this is called conventional truth;
I say that all dharmas are produced by relying on conditions,
This is called approaching ultimate truth, the wise should contemplate.
The eye does not see forms, the mind also does not know dharmas,
This is called ultimate truth, the foolish are unable to know.
At that time, after the World-Honored One had spoken this Dharma, the king of Magadha, Shadow-Conquering, deeply accepted it with a sincere mind.
